fi.sorberIT
Class ReplaceXML

java.lang.Object
  fi.sorberIT.ReplaceXML

public class ReplaceXML
extends java.lang.Object

ReplaceXML class is used to replace all the special characters in the xml file. Before we use SAXParser to parse the xml file, some special characters like "&" in file will cause problems. We need to replace them by normal characters so that the SAXParser can work well.

Remember to write the changes into file after we replace the special characters, because when we use FileInputStream to read the data from file and change them, actually, the values have not changed. So we must use FileOutputStream to write the changes into file.

In the main class SaxParse, methods in ReplaceXML will be called before SAXParser works. Pay attention to the encoding of the xml file. The file and the SAXParser's encoding is utf-8, but the FileInputStream and FileOutputStream's default encoding is gb2312. So when we use the FileOutputSteam to write changes into file, we must use utf-8 encoding so that the parser can works well.

Author:
Song Xin
